title: Photos of the week
text:
Pictures | Fri May 4, 2018 | 2:00pm EDT Photos of the week
South Korean President Moon Jae-in and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un shake hands at the truce village of Panmunjom inside the demilitarized zone separating the two Koreas, South Korea. Korea Summit Press Pool/Pool via Reuters Reuters / Friday, April 27, 2018 South Korean President Moon Jae-in and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un shake hands at the truce village of Panmunjom inside the demilitarized zone separating the two Koreas, South Korea. Korea Summit Press Pool/Pool via Reuters Close 1 / 20
A border patrol agent apprehends a woman and a man after they were caught illegally crossing into the U.S. border from Mexico near McAllen, Texas. REUTERS/Adrees Latif Reuters / Wednesday, May 02, 2018 A border patrol agent apprehends a woman and a man after they were caught illegally crossing into the U.S. border from Mexico near McAllen, Texas. REUTERS/Adrees Latif Close 2 / 20
Tear gas canisters are fired by Israeli troops at Palestinian demonstrators during clashes at a protest demanding the right to return to their homeland, at Sunday, April 29, 2018 Tear gas canisters are fired by Israeli troops at Palestinian demonstrators during clashes at a protest demanding the right to return to their homeland, at 3 / 20
Buddhist monks wait to receive alms during the birth anniversary of Buddha, also known as Vesak Day, at Boudhanath Stupa in Kathmandu, Nepal. REUTERS/Navesh Chitrakar Reuters / Monday, April 30, 2018 Buddhist monks wait to receive alms during the birth anniversary of Buddha, also known as Vesak Day, at Boudhanath Stupa in Kathmandu, Nepal. REUTERS/Navesh Chitrakar Close 4 / 20
Members of a caravan of migrants from Central America climb up the border fence between Mexico and the U.S., as a part of a demonstration prior to preparations for an asylum request in the U.S., in Tijuana, Mexico. REUTERS/Edgard Garrido Reuters / Sunday, April 29, 2018 Members of a caravan of migrants from Central America climb up the border fence between Mexico and the U.S., as a part of a demonstration prior to preparations for an asylum request in the U.S., in Tijuana, Mexico. REUTERS/Edgard Garrido Close 5 / 20
A baby cries in the arms of an amateur sumo wrestler during a baby crying contest at Sensoji temple in Tokyo. In the contest two wrestlers each hold a baby while a referee makes faces and loud noises to make them cry. The baby who cries the loudest... more Reuters / Saturday, April 28, 2018 A baby cries in the arms of an amateur sumo wrestler during a baby crying contest at Sensoji temple in Tokyo. In the contest two wrestlers each hold a baby while a referee makes faces and loud noises to make them cry. The baby who cries the loudest wins. The ritual is believed to aid the healthy growth of the children and ward off evil spirits. 160 children took part in the event in this year, the organizer said. REUTERS/Issei Kato Close 6 / 20
Afghan journalists are seen after a second blast in Kabul. Explosions in the Afghan capital killed at least 26 people on Monday, including nine journalists who had arrived to report on an initial blast and were apparently targeted by a suicide... more Reuters / Monday, April 30, 2018 Afghan journalists are seen after a second blast in Kabul. Explosions in the Afghan capital killed at least 26 people on Monday, including nine journalists who had arrived to report on an initial blast and were apparently targeted by a suicide bomber, officials said. REUTERS/Omar Sobhani Close 7 / 20
The sun is seen rising over skyscrapers in the City of London financial district. REUTERS/Toby Melville Reuters / Thursday, May 03, 2018 The sun is seen rising over skyscrapers in the City of London financial district. REUTERS/Toby Melville Close 8 / 20
U.S. President Donald Trump poses with children of staff and press in the Oval Office of the White House on "take your child to work day" in Washington. U.S., April 26, 2018. REUTERS/Kevin Lamarque TPX IMAGES OF THE DAY Reuters / Thursday, April 26, 2018 U.S. President Donald Trump poses with children of staff and press in the Oval Office of the White House on "take your child to work day" in Washington. U.S., April 26, 2018. REUTERS/Kevin Lamarque TPX IMAGES OF THE DAY Close 9 / 20
Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu speaks during a news conference at the Ministry of Defence in Tel Aviv. REUTERS/Amir Cohen Reuters / Monday, April 30, 2018 Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu speaks during a news conference at the Ministry of Defence in Tel Aviv. REUTERS/Amir Cohen Close 10 / 20
A firefighter looks at a church and a building that caught fire and collapsed in the center of Sao Wednesday, May 02, 2018 A firefighter looks at a church and a building that caught fire and collapsed in the center of Sao 11 / 20
A man evacuates his horse from the area as the fire burns through a pile of old tires at a recycling center in Ciudad Juarez, Mexico. REUTERS/Jose Luis Gonzalez Reuters / Wednesday, May 02, 2018 A man evacuates his horse from the area as the fire burns through a pile of old tires at a recycling center in Ciudad Juarez, Mexico. REUTERS/Jose Luis Gonzalez Close 12 / 20
A worker dismantles loudspeakers that were set up for propaganda broadcasts near the demilitarized zone separating the two Koreas in Paju, South Korea. REUTERS/Kim Hong-Ji/Pool Reuters / Tuesday, May 01, 2018 A worker dismantles loudspeakers that were set up for propaganda broadcasts near the demilitarized zone separating the two Koreas in Paju, South Korea. REUTERS/Kim Hong-Ji/Pool Close 13 / 20
A farmer, also known as a jimador clears the area surrounding blue agave before it is harvested in Tepatitlan, Jalisco, Mexico. REUTERS/Carlos Jasso Reuters / Wednesday, May 02, 2018 A farmer, also known as a jimador clears the area surrounding blue agave before it is harvested in Tepatitlan, Jalisco, Mexico. REUTERS/Carlos Jasso Close 14 / 20
Garra rufa obtusas, also known as 'doctor fish', swim around the face of a man as he relaxes in a hot spa pool in Kangal, south of the central Anatolian city of Sivas, Turkey. REUTERS/Umit Bektas Reuters / Monday, April 30, 2018 Garra rufa obtusas, also known as 'doctor fish', swim around the face of a man as he relaxes in a hot spa pool in Kangal, south of the central Anatolian city of Sivas, Turkey. REUTERS/Umit Bektas Close 15 / 20
A car burns outside a Renault automobile garage during clashes at the May Day labour union march in Paris, France. REUTERS/Christian Hartmann Reuters / Tuesday, May 01, 2018 A car burns outside a Renault automobile garage during clashes at the May Day labour union march in Paris, France. REUTERS/Christian Hartmann Close 16 / 20
People gather at the rooftop of the Metropolitan Cathedral during a protest march to demand an end to violence in Managua, Nicaragua. REUTERS /Jose Cabezas Reuters / Saturday, April 28, 2018 People gather at the rooftop of the Metropolitan Cathedral during a protest march to demand an end to violence in Managua, Nicaragua. REUTERS /Jose Cabezas Close 17 / 20
A woman affected by tear gas is assisted during a May Day protest against austerity measures, in San Juan, Puerto Rico. REUTERS/Alvin Baez Reuters / Wednesday, May 02, 2018 A woman affected by tear gas is assisted during a May Day protest against austerity measures, in San Juan, Puerto Rico. REUTERS/Alvin Baez Close 18 / 20
A worker checks the heat of an oven while melting iron before pouring it into moulds to produce machine parts at a foundry, ahead of the International Labour Day or May Day, in Karachi, Pakistan. REUTERS/Akhtar Soomro Reuters / Monday, April 30, 2018 A worker checks the heat of an oven while melting iron before pouring it into moulds to produce machine parts at a foundry, ahead of the International Labour Day or May Day, in Karachi, Pakistan. REUTERS/Akhtar Soomro Close 19 / 20
A woman adjusts her sun glasses as she has her picture taken amid thousands of ranunculus flowers at the Flower Fields in Carlsbad, California. REUTERS/Mike Blake Reuters / Thursday, April 26, 2018 A woman adjusts her sun glasses as she has her picture taken amid thousands of ranunculus flowers at the Flower Fields in Carlsbad, California. REUTERS/Mike Blake Close
